translation.en: [guy] Guys, get off me!
Get off me!
Hey, get off me!
[man] Jesus said, "You have to put me before other people,

Hitler-- That was a demand, to be in the Nazi party.
They had to put the Nazi party and its objectives

translation.ko: 아버지, 어머니, 형제자매 자신의 인생보다 앞세웠죠

translation.en: That was a covenant. A pledge.
But the real work is invisible.
translation.ko: 하지만 실제 하는 일은 보이지 않습니다

translation.en: And it is invisibly spreading.
The more you can make your organization invisible, the more influence it'll have.
translation.ko: 안 보이는 조직을 만들수록 영향력이 커집니다

translation.en: [man 2] They will accuse me of betraying their trust.
translation.ko: 그들은 신뢰를 저버렸다고 저를 비난할 겁니다

translation.en: In a fundamental way, I did.
They want to be a secret, invisible organization.
translation.ko: 그들은 비밀스럽고 안 보이는 조직이고 싶어 하는데

translation.en: I wrote two books about them.
But the story is no longer just about my experience.
translation.ko: 하지만 이젠 제 경험에만 국한된 이야기가 아닙니다

translation.en: [man 3] It took a long time before I realized just who the Family was,
translation.ko: '더 패밀리'의 정체와 그들이 이 나라 지도층에게 끼치는

translation.en: and the influence they have had in the leadership of our country.
This was a group with tentacles around the world,
meeting with presidents, foreign leaders,

translation.en: [newscaster] The National Prayer Breakfast:

translation.ko: 국가 조찬 기도회는 워싱턴 DC에서 열리는 행사로 아이젠하워 이후 공화, 민주당의 대통령이 참석합니다

translation.en: since Eisenhower.
translation.ko: 아이젠하워 이후 공화, 민주당의 대통령이 참석합니다

translation.en: who made this all possible.
[woman] They said he's the most powerful man in Washington you've never heard of.
translation.ko: 워싱턴 DC 역사상 최고의 권력자라고 했어요

translation.en: He's like the Wizard of Oz.
[Reagan] I wish I could say more about it,
but it's working precisely because it is private.
[man] We need to reach leaders. And then if you reach the leaders,
translation.ko: 지도자에게 손을 뻗어야 합니다 그렇게 지도자를 확보하면

translation.en: then the whole nation will be influenced for Christ.
translation.ko: 온 나라를 예수님의 영향권에 둘 수 있어요

translation.en: The notion was floated: What if we lived together?
translation.ko: 다 같이 살면 어떨까? 이런 생각을 하기 시작했죠

translation.en: I was part of a group called C Street when I was in Washington.
translation.ko: 전 워싱턴에 있을 때 C 스트리트 소속이었습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Governor Mark Sanford, Senator John Ensign,
translation.ko: 마크 샌퍼드 주지사 존 엔슨 상원 의원

translation.en: all embroiled in scandal...
Doing the Lord's work in the devil's playground.
[man] We meet with some really horrible people.
Dictators and murderers and thieves.
If I were a bad faith actor from another country,
that is exactly the kind of meeting that I would want to exploit.
[man] Everybody in the room had their hands on this President-elect.
translation.ko: 모든 참석자가 대통령 당선자에게 손을 얹었어요

translation.en: [man 2] This is what the Family's been waiting for.
He's God's man.
[woman] And they say it's about faith,
but there's a shared understanding
that what we're really about here is power.
translation.ko: 권력 때문이란 걸 모두 알고 있어요

translation.en: [man] I lived with those guys,
prayed with them at their headquarters at the seat of their power.
There were congressmen, senators, world leaders.
An invisible organization that had been hiding in plain sight for over 80 years.
translation.ko: 80년 넘게 수면에 드러나지 않던 비밀 조직이었습니다

translation.en: [man 2] People think that there's something sinister.
There has to be a conspiracy.
It's the furthest thing from the truth.
[woman] It's a breathtaking enmeshment of Church and State.
translation.ko: 교계와 국가가 절대 빠져나오기 힘든 그물이에요

translation.en: [man] A humble example of leadership
that the world has never seen.
-[man 2] That's a corruption of democracy. -[man 3] It's the power of God.
[man 4] This is something that the world desperately needs.
[man 1] Hark! All worry will be left behind.
translation.ko: "NETFLIX 오리지널 다큐멘터리 시리즈" 들어라, 모든 걱정은 뒤로 남겨질 것이다

translation.en: All disappointment, too,
will be gone forever.
[man 2] We adopted a program for a worldwide spiritual offensive.
[man 3] I know, as never before.
that we are all God's children.
[man 1] There is only one thing we can take with us through that door.
translation.ko: 저 문을 통과할 때 우린 단 하나만 가져갈 수 있어요

translation.en: Those whom we have led to the Savior.
[man] Fear him. Love him.
Submit yourself completely.
Then you will be His disciple.
[George W. Bush] What we have begun, we will finish.
translation.ko: 우리가 시작한 일은 우리가 끝낼 겁니다

translation.en: [man] One of the things I've always found interesting, even as a boy,
translation.ko: 아주 어렸을 때부터 항상 저를 사로잡은 건

translation.en: is the idea that there are these battles between good and evil;
that we are actively engaged in a war with the forces of evil every day,
translation.ko: 우리가 악의 세력과 매일 치열하게 교전하고

translation.en: and that there are demonic influences in our lives,
translation.ko: 우리 인생이 악마의 영향력 아래 있으며

translation.en: and that you have to be on guard.
So as a boy, this, on the one hand, makes the world a much scarier place.
translation.ko: 어린아이 입장에선 그런 점에서 세상이 더 두렵기도 하지만 "제프 샬렛 '더 패밀리' 작가"

translation.en: On the other hand, it makes the world a more exciting place.
My mother died of breast cancer.
Um... She was young, and I was just a kid.
She grew up in vaguely Pentecostal Christianity.
translation.ko: 오순절파 신앙에 살짝 발만 담근 가정에서 성장하셨는데

translation.en: And as she lay dying,
she would invite members of various faiths in to pray with her.
translation.ko: 다양한 교파의 분들을 모셔 기도를 부탁했어요

translation.en: And I noticed some of them prayed for her salvation,
translation.ko: 어떤 분들은 구원을 청하는 기도를 하시더군요

translation.en: that she would become a member of their faith, even in death.

for a reprieve from her suffering, so that she might live longer.
translation.ko: 고통을 덜어내 더 살게 해 달라고요

translation.en: And that question of deliverance versus salvation,
the world to come or freedom now,
really struck me,
and has lead me into all the stories that I've been interested in ever since.
translation.ko: "창세기 11장 6절 바벨 여긴 미국이 아니다" 그 후로 이런 이야기에 천착하게 되었죠 "절망과 구조"

translation.en: When I was in my early 20s, I decided to write about religion.
translation.ko: 20대 초반에 종교에 대한 글을 쓰기로 했어요 "알고 싶다"

translation.en: And I was living in New York, working on this book,
translation.ko: 뉴욕에 살면서 이 책을 집필하고 있었는데

translation.en: and I'd heard that an old friend of mine, a man named Luke, was in town.
translation.ko: 루크라는 옛날 친구가 뉴욕에 왔다는 얘길 들었어요

translation.en: Luke was a very promising guy,
from a sort of an upper-class family, and had a fine trajectory to his life.
Engaged to be married, and building a financial career.
But then he left all that
translation.ko: 그러다 갑자기 모든 걸 뒤로 하고

translation.en: and moved across the country to join, um, what his family feared was a cult.
translation.ko: 나라를 횡단해 가족이 사교라고 의심하는 종교에 들어갔어요

translation.en: He seemed to just drop out, just to disappear.
translation.ko: 그 친구는 세상과 연을 끊고 잠적하려는 것만 같았어요

translation.en: And so his family said, because they knew I wrote about religion,
translation.ko: 제가 종교 관련 책을 쓴다는 걸 알았던 루크의 가족은

translation.en: they said, "Would you meet with him and sort of see what he's up to?"
translation.ko: 아들을 만나 뭘 하는지 알아봐달라고 했어요

translation.en: This was very shortly after 9/11.
And one of the things he said he was there for--
He wanted to survey the ruins of secularism.
But he said, "Now we see clearly. This is a battle between good and evil."
translation.ko: 그러면서 말했죠 '다들 목격했지' '이건 선과 악의 전쟁이야'

translation.en: He seems to be a transformed person.
And he told me about this amorphous thing that he had joined.
-He says... [voices overlap] -"They're not Christians."
We're followers of Jesus, and we just serve.
Who do you serve?
Men who are chosen by God for leadership.
Politicians.
-Is there an organization? -No.
No church, no ministers, no rules and rituals.
You read the Bible, though, right?
Sure, sure, but mostly, we work.
translation.ko: 물론이지 하지만 주로 하는 건 일이야

translation.en: We...
rake leaves, play basketball, clean toilets.
translation.ko: 낙엽을 쓸고 농구 하고 화장실을 청소해

translation.en: Wait, you clean toilets... for politicians?
translation.ko: 잠깐, 정치인들을 위해 화장실 청소를 한다고?

translation.en: [laughs] I know it sounds weird...
-Yeah. -...but it's not.
It's just a bunch of guys living together.
It's great.
[Jeff Sharlet] It seemed so simple.
And then he invited me to come see it for myself.
translation.ko: 그러더니 제게 한번 와 보라고 했어요

translation.en: And knowing almost nothing of it, I did.
translation.ko: 전 아무것도 모르는 채로 가 봤어요

translation.en: [man] Do you take drugs, alcohol, or prescription medication?
translation.ko: 마약, 술 또는 처방 약을 복용합니까?

translation.en: [Sharlet] You only got in by being recommended.
And had to go through a little interview at this office on Capitol Hill,
translation.ko: 국회의사당의 어느 사무실에서 간단하게 면접을 봤어요

translation.en: with a senior aide to a Republican senator from Oklahoma at the time.
translation.ko: 당시 공화당 소속 오클라호마주 상원의원의 수석 보좌관에게요

translation.en: [aide] And do you have a girlfriend?
[Sharlet] He asked me about my relationship with my girlfriend...
-[aide] Is she Christian? -Yeah.
[Sharlet] ...and about my parents.
Questions that I would later come to understand
were sort of testing how much was I willing to renounce.
translation.ko: 제가 어디까지 인연을 끊을 수 있는지 묻는 거였어요

translation.en: -And I answered them very honestly. -[inaudible]
Because you have to understand,
I was in no way an investigative journalist at this time.
translation.ko: 탐사 취재를 하는 기자 입장이 절대로 아니었으니까요

translation.en: -[aide] Were you close with your mom? -I was, yeah.
[Sharlet] There was no stealth, no cleverness.
I told them I was a writer,
and I'd been traveling around the country,
trying to understand all the different ideas of Jesus,
translation.ko: 예수님에 대한 다양한 생각을 이해하려고 전국을 여행하고 있다고 말했어요

translation.en: and I was interested in getting to know theirs.
[aide] Rent is $400.
That's with room and board.
[Sharlet] I think it was about a week later.
I passed the test. I was welcome to come and just live with them
translation.ko: 테스트를 통과했어요 이제 그들과 같이 살면서

translation.en: and be a brother, as they put it.
A group of the brothers had come to pick me up,
and they drove me across the river to Arlington, Virginia,
a suburb of Washington
where a lot of intelligence community folks live.
And we went down into this cul-de-sac
and past this big, beautiful Georgian mansion.
translation.ko: 웅장하고 아름다운 조지 왕조풍 저택을 지나갔어요

translation.en: -Nice house, huh? -Yeah.
Look, I didn't know how to explain you to the guys,
so I just said that we're getting a new dude. He's from New York.
-He's a writer. He's Jewish. -Half-Jewish, actually.
And he wants to know Jesus.
Know what they said?
No.
"Bring him on."
Let's go.

translation.ko: 남자 숙소가 있고 근처에 여자 숙소가 있죠 "개넌 심스, 옛 형제"

translation.en: and it was this little enclave,

Religious, non-religious,

translation.en: No swearing, no drinking.
No sex, no self.
You don't waste time on newspapers. Never watch TV.

[Sharlet] You eat meat. You study the gospels.

-Yeah, here we go. -I got outside.
[Sharlet] God loves a man who can sink a three-pointer.
translation.ko: 하나님이 사랑하는 건 3점 슛을 넣는 남자예요

translation.en: [brother] Hey, Jeff.
Will you lead us in prayer?
[Jeff] Sure.
[sighs] Lord, uh, Lord God,
uh, Heavenly Father.
Jesus, thank you so much for...
the guys here, and...
um, the chance to play basketball, and to...
to learn teamwork, and, um...
And learn how to fight for you.
translation.ko: 주님을 위해 싸우는 법을 배우게 해주셔서요

translation.en: We pray all this in Jesus' name. Amen.
-Amen. -Amen.
[Sharlet] The kind of storytelling that I've always found interesting
is submerging of yourself in the lives of others.
Crossing into that world of belief until you're a little bit lost.
translation.ko: 믿음의 세계를 넘나들다 약간은 길을 잃어버리는 이야기요

translation.en: It's spiritually dangerous,
in the sense that you could be converted.
And at Ivanwald, it meant seeing what happens if, for a time at least,
translation.ko: 아이번월드에서는 잠깐이라도 그들의 사상을 받아들일 경우

translation.en: I accepted their ideas.
"Where shall I flee from your presence?
If I ascend into heaven, you are there.
If I make my bed in the depths, you are there."
[brother] It's intense, right?
It's like, you can't run.
Doesn't matter where you turn,

translation.ko: 주님이 그 자리에서 기다리고 계신다는 거야

translation.en: Jesus is smart.
He's going to get you.
Let's pray.
[Luke] "I call out to the Lord.
I pray to him for his favor."
"I praise you for I am fearful..."
[Sharlet] We would pray to be broken.
We would pray to be nothing.
We would pray to learn how to obey.
[brother] In here, we're safe with our brothers, learning the ways of Jesus.
translation.ko: 여기선 형제들과 예수님의 길을 배우니까 안전해

translation.en: [Sharlet] They said this is our prime relationship with this Jesus.
translation.ko: 우리와 예수님의 관계는 그래야 한다고 말했어요

translation.en: -[brother] Does that make sense to you? -Yeah.
And so we would pray to crush what we would call our inner rebel.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리 안의 반역자를 처단해 달라고 기도했죠

translation.en: -Jeff? -Hey.
-I see you're writing a lot down. -Yeah.
But are you listening?
I know it's a lot to take in,
but this is all you really need.
It's the Bible. It's the part that matters.
It's just Jesus.
[Sharlet] One of the things that surprised me was that

translation.ko: 성경 자체에 별 관심이 없다는 점이었어요

translation.en: There was a small book that you're given.
translation.ko: 거기서 얇은 책 한 권을 줘요

translation.en: This little book that says "Jesus."
That's it. Just Jesus, nothing else.
And it was four gospels: Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John,
with the Book of Acts referred to here as Acts of Ambassadors.
And they didn't need to read too much further than that.
translation.ko: 거기선 이것 외에는 더 읽을 필요가 없었어요

translation.en: There's not a whole lot of theology.
There's no wrestling with God, with conscience,
traditional concerns of fundamentalism. They don't talk about the devil.
translation.ko: 근본주의의 전통적 고민을 짊어지지 않고 사탄 얘기도 안 했어요

translation.en: Just Jesus. Just Jesus. That's all.
Now, which part of Jesus was Psalm 137?
translation.ko: 시편 137편 중 어디가 예수님에 관한 걸까?

translation.en: "O daughter of Babylon who are to be destroyed,
happy shall he be that taketh the little ones

Which part of Jesus would be in that?
Jeff, brother, I don't know,

translation.ko: 하지만 때가 되면 예수님께서 반드시 알려주실 거야

translation.en: [Sharlet] They said Christianity's been misunderstood.
translation.ko: 그들은 기독교 신앙이 잘못 이해되고 있다고 했어요

translation.en: That all the rubes out there, the suckers,
they think that Christ came to preach equally to everybody. Not so.
translation.ko: 예수님이 평등을 설파하러 오셨다고 믿지만 아니라고요

translation.en: They said he had rings of power. Closest are James and Peter.
translation.ko: 예수님 권력 고리의 가장 안쪽에 야고보와 베드로가 있고

translation.en: Then you go out another circle, and there's the disciples.
And out here...
is everybody else, and they'll get the message,
translation.ko: 나머지 사람들이 있는데 이들은 메시지를 듣긴 해도

translation.en: but they won't get it in unvarnished form.
They can't handle the truth.
Let us be nothing.
[Sharlet] But now we've moved from this outer ring to one of those very near inner circles.
translation.ko: 거기에 있는 우린 바깥쪽 고리에서 안으로 들어온 사람들이었죠

translation.en: -And we are the new chosen. -[brother] Please, Jesus...
-[Sharlet] The ones that matter. -...work through us.
[Sharlet] As a brother in Ivanwald, as one among these new chosen,
translation.ko: 아이번월드의 형제가 되어 새로 선택된 자로 살면서

translation.en: some of us were assigned to work in their headquarters called the Cedars.
We would rake leaves. We'd clean toilets.
I thought this was so absurd,
this religious movement of humbling yourself
by cleaning the toilets of the powerful.
[Luke] Load some of these up.
[Sharlet] The Cedars is this big, white-pillared mansion
translation.ko: 시더스는 흰 기둥이 있는 웅장한 저택이에요

translation.en: that looks a little bit like the White House.
And it is very clearly the seat of their power,
translation.ko: "대의권이 없어도 납세는 한다" 권력의 핵심부라는 게 명백해요

translation.en: because it's where they host a lot of foreign leaders.
Wait, I recognize him.
That's that, uh, Republican Senator from Oklahoma.
[Luke] Yeah. They all come here.
Left, right,
Republican, Democrat.
But those terms don't reflect the movement's vision.
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 단어는 운동의 비전을 반영하지 않지

translation.en: It's bigger than that.
